page.title: 12The Bramley Apple.
page.content: The{Bramley Apple}is one of the best cooking apples in the world. At{ {73,Church Street}there is a cottage called{Bramley Tree Cottage.}It has the{original}Bramley Apple Tree in its garden. It grew from a pip planted by{ {Miss Mary Brailsford}between 1809-1815 The apple tree was exhibited before { {The Royal Horticultural Society}in 1876. The tree is still alive and is the mother of all the{Bramley trees}in the world. The present owner is{Mrs {B.C.Howard}and visiters are welcome. {Merryweathers Garden Centre}help to prune the tree every year. Near the cottage there is a pub called{The {Bramley Apple.}The apple hanging outside the pub is a cooking apple. The pub used to be called{The George {and the Dragon.}A few years ago some students changed the apple to a core on{April Fool's Day.
